newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares rise to new high with bank focus.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares rise to new high with bank focus.

text.p: Sweden's sharemarket rose to a new high on Monday, taking over from gains on Wall Street and with advances mixed across the bourse.
The Stockholm general index climbed 0.72 percent to 2273.00 after fairly active turnover of 4.5 billion crowns.
"It was quite a strong day," said one broker.

The banking and insurance sector was in focus after insurer Skandia and mortgage bank Stadshypotek announced a proposed merger to create a massive Nordic finance company with assets worth 500 billion crowns.
Brokers, however, were sceptical if it would ever proceed.
Stadshypotek closed five higher at 203 crowns with brokers saying the stock was underpriced.
Telecoms giant Ericsson posted gains, closing 3.5 crowns higher at 208 crowns. Fellow bluechip, drugs major Astra, rose 0.5 to 318 crowns.
Appliance maker Electrolux rose seven to 394 crowns, boosted by general optimism in the sector worldwide.
